comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,25 +24,24 @@
 
 #include "event/socket.c.generated.h"
 
+/// Checks if an address string looks like a TCP endpoint (as opposed to a local pipe/socket path).
+///
+/// The key distinction is that TCP addresses contain ":" (e.g. "127.0.0.1:1234", "::1:5678"),
+/// while local paths don't  except on Windows where drive letter paths like "C:\..." contain ":".

comment_data.body: These lines can be removed

the `restart` event (and any other parts of the protocol) should be shaped so that we have the option of supporting remote/TCP scenarios in the future. `String listen_addr` might already meet that requirement (it can hold `port:path`), just mentioning in case there are other considerations I missed.

The idea for me here was to "guess" a new TCP listen address but I see how it could be bad if the UI and server are on different machines. So it is probably better to not deal with this here.

However, if we are dropping this "guessing" workflow, we should also consider having an option to specify this new listen address.

> having an option to specify this new listen address.

not sure what you mean. a user-facing option is not acceptable. the main goal is just to make sure that in the future, we can use the "guessing" approach or whatever and without needing to change the UI protocol.
hmm... I would not expect this to be needed. The "old server" shouldn't create the new address; instead, it should start a new Nvim and get the new address from the new Nvim.
if you feel like it, maybe break out this change into a separate PR and we can merge it sooner.
`os_delay` ? https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6e1745e96e3d74ee7958904b81a3f8ebfe404184/src/nvim/os/time.c#L55

My initial idea was to hold the channel open to the new server, get its VV_SEND_SERVER, close the channel (with detach so the server doesn't stop) and then proceed with restart.

It was so long ago but I remember having some error with it which didn't work for me locally....

Tbh, I should explore that further....
Wait what does this mean? :sweat_smile:

I remembered..
Starting the new server with `--embed --headless` and then connecting to it via RPC to get send server causes the new server to self-exit on channel close when the old server executes "+cmd".
ideally we would avoid this, looks like a smell

> causes the new server to self-exit on channel close

well we need to figure out how to make that work, rather than doing fragile workarounds :) in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30319 I was playing around with the idea of `chanclose({detach:boolean})`, does that sound like it would help?

Note that we already have (and use) that concept internally: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6e1745e96e3d74ee7958904b81a3f8ebfe404184/src/nvim/channel.h#L34-L36
is this while-loop necessary if we [start the server before emitting](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/35223#discussion_r2814135661) the UI event?
